clinical_study.brief_title: Daily Assessment of Mood and Social Media Behaviors Study
clinical_study.official_title: Daily Assessment of Mood and Social Media Behaviors Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to learn more about social media usage and its relation to emotions, biology, and mental health. Participants will complete daily assessments (5 times a day) over the course of 11 days in which they will report on their social media use, behaviors, and mood. During the first 4 days participants will be asked to continue using social media as typical. In the second half (7 days) participants will be randomized to social media usage groups (0 minutes, 30 minutes, 1 hour, 2 hour, 3 hours). There will be mental health and well-being measures provided at the beginning and end of the study. Lastly, to better understand how social media usage effects underlying mechanisms of stress, participants will be asked to provide saliva samples for 3 nights (pre, mid, and post) to assess for basal cortisol levels.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants will be randomized to social media usage groups to assess if reduction social media will improve mood and in turn lower depressive and anxiety symptoms. The groups include 0 minutes, 30 minutes, 1 hour, 2 hour, 3 hours of use a day.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in "Positive and Negative Affect Schedule" (PANAS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre and post. Daily 5 times a day for 11 days
primary_outcome.description: Examines mood fluctuations. Scores can range from 10-50 for both the Positive and Negative Affect with the lower scores representing lower levels of Positive/Negative Affect and higher scores representing higher levels of Positive/Negative Affect.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in "Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale" (DASS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre and Post. Daily for 11 days
primary_outcome.description: Examines Depressive, Anxiety, and Stress symptoms. Minimum 0 maximum 63. Higher scores indicate more depression, anxiety and or stress.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in "Behavioral Activation for Depression Scale"
primary_outcome.description: Examines behavioral goal achievement. Minimum 0 and maximum 54. Larger scores means an ability to be more active.
Survey and Phone based Applications will assess for daily use of social media time and behaviors.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in "A clinically useful depression outcome scale" (CUDOS)
primary_outcome.description: Tracks Depression Symptoms. Minimum 0 maximum 74. Larger scores means more depressive symptoms.

arm_group.description: Participants will be asked to refrain from using all social media
Participants will be asked to only use social media at most 30 minutes a day.
Participants will be asked to only use social media at most 60 minutes a day.
Participants will be asked to only use social media at most 120 minutes a day.
Participants will be asked to only use social media at most 180 minutes a day.

intervention.description: Behavioral Intervention of social media usage.
